description: Triangle of a(n,k) = number of k-member minimal covers of an n-set (n >= k >= 1).
comments: These are what Clarke calls "Minimal disordered k-covers of labeled n-set".
references: R. J. Clarke, Covering a set by subsets, Discrete Math., 81 (1990), 147-152.
T. Hearne and C. G. Wagner, Minimal covers of finite sets, Discr. Math. 5 (1973), 247-251.
Macula, Anthony J., Lewis Carroll and the enumeration of minimal covers.  Math. Mag. 68 (1995), 269-274.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..75, flattened
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Minimal Cover
formula: a(n,k) = Sum_{j >= 0} (-1)^j * binomial(k,j) * (2^k-1-j)^n. [Hearne-Wagner]a(n,k) = Sum_{j >= k} binomial(2^k-k-1,j-k)*j!*Stirling2(n,j). [Macula]E.g.f.: Sum((exp(y)-1)^n*exp(y*(2^n-n-1))*x^n/n!, n=0..infinity). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, May 08 2004
maple: with(combinat):a:= (n, k)-> add(binomial(2^k-k-1, m-k)*m!   *stirling2(n, m), m=k..min(n, 2^k-1))/k!:seq(seq(a(n, k), k=1..n), n=1..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 02 2013
mathematica: a[n_, k_] := Sum[ (-1)^i*(2^k-i-1)^n / (i!*(k-i)!), {i, 0, k}]; Flatten[ Table[ a[n, k], {n, 1, 9}, {k, 1, n}]] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 13 2011, after Pari *)
prog: (PARI) {a(n, k) = sum(i=0, k, (-1)^i * binomial(k, i) * (2^k-1-i)^n) / k!} /* _Michael Somos_, Aug 05 1999 */
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Explicit formulas added by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 05 2011
